terms.definition: Software as a Service - a cloud-based software delivery model where applications are hosted by a service provider and accessed via the internet
A centralized repository of information, documentation, and resources that provides answers to common questions and solutions to problems
Standard Operating Procedures - detailed written instructions that describe how to perform routine tasks or processes consistently
A system that tracks and manages changes to documents or code over time, allowing users to see revision history and revert to previous versions
A feature that allows multiple people to work on the same document or project simultaneously in real-time
The use of software to automatically execute repetitive tasks and processes based on predefined rules and triggers
Pre-designed document formats that provide a standardized structure and layout for creating consistent documentation
Enterprise Resource Planning - integrated software systems that manage and automate core business processes across an organization
The ability of a platform to handle and display various file types including PDFs, spreadsheets, images, and multimedia content
The state of having documentation organized, accessible, and compliant for regulatory inspections or compliance reviews
Material Safety Data Sheets - documents that provide detailed information about chemical substances including hazards, handling, and safety precautions
The assurance that documents remain accurate, complete, and unaltered throughout their lifecycle
A system where all documents and information are stored in a single, unified location accessible to authorized users
The process of teams from different organizational departments working together on shared documents or projects
An interconnected network of digital tools, platforms, and systems that work together to support business operations
